intro: Oreomyrrhis daucoides, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions, often at high elevations. Its leaves are basal, linear, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are white or pale pink and arranged in a dense cluster. Oreomyrrhis daucoides is a perennial herb that is adapted to harsh, arid environments.
